intro: Triumfetta pilosa var. glabrescens, commonly known as the silky triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant features small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, velvety texture. Its flowers are usually small and pale green or white, clustered in dense inflorescences. The species is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides.
